intro: Disporum, commonly known as the foamflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to eastern North America. The plants are perennial herbs with rhizomatous stems that produce clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. Their foliage consists of broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often evergreen in some species. Disporum is valued in gardens for its ornamental foliage and delicate floral display.
